title: The internet praises Twitter detective Dave who urged Coleen Rooney to investigate leaked stories
text:
Coleen Rooney may have a Manchester based poker player to thank after she turned super sleuth to investigate who has been leaking private stories about her family to the press.

Coleen, 33, accused fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy on Wednesday of allegedly taking stories from her private social media accounts and selling them on, but it turns out she may have had a helping hand in her investigations.

The wife of footballer Wayne first hinted stories were being leaked back in January, with her tweet prompting a follower to advise her on how to catch the culprit.

Helping hand: Coleen Rooney may have a Manchester based poker player to thank for solving the mystery of who had been leaking private stories about her family to the press

On January 27 2019 Coleen tweeted about a false story regarding a car crash she had supposedly been involved in.

'Thank you for the messages asking if I am ok… the car crash story was completely wrong,' she wrote. 'I wasn't involved in a crash... the car was damaged by another car.

'Someone on my private Instagram seen the picture and is telling or selling stories to a certain newspaper.'

Feud: Coleen, 33, accused fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy on Wednesday of allegedly taking stories from her private social media accounts and selling them to them to the press

Going on for months: The wife of footballer Wayne first hinted stories were being leaked back in January, with a tweet prompting one of her followers advising her on her to catch the culprit

Turn detective: Amid the replies was a message from a Manchester based fan called Dave who promptly advised the WAG

She added in a further tweet: 'It's happened several times now over the past couple of years. It's sad to think someone, who I have accepted to follow me is betraying for either money or to keep a relationship with the press.'

Amid the replies was a message from a Manchester based fan called Dave who promptly advised the WAG: 'Make a false story tell people different things see which one comes out = find the culprit.'

Dave's reply was unearthed on Wednesday as the Rooney and Vardy feud exploded, with many saying Coleen had Dave to thank for giving her the idea to plant false stories on her Instagram account.

Pride: Dave has since changed his Twitter bio to reflect his skilled work and newfound fame, adding the line: 'Detective who recently solved the coleen rooney vs rebekah vardy case'

On Wednesday morning the mother of four posted on Twitter and Instagram, admitting she has been planting false Instagram stories on her private page and blocking all her friends apart from Rebekah.

She admitted that stories about her basement flooding, returning to TV and gender selection were only viewed by Rebekah and these stories subsequently appeared in The Sun.

Twitter praised Dave for nudging Coleen in the right direction, with one tweeting her: 'You owe Dave a pint after that amazing idea, surely?'

Well done Dave! Twitter praised Dave for giving Coleen the idea, with one tweeting her: 'You owe Dave a pint after that amazing idea, surely?'

Another labelled the duo 'Sherlock and Watson,' and one fan advised: 'find yourself a friend who takes care of you like Dave here took care of Coleen.'

'If we're sending Coleen to fix Brexit, Dave is her Dominic Cummings,' read another inspired tweet.

Dave has since changed his Twitter bio to reflect his skilled work and newfound fame, adding the line: 'Detective who recently solved the coleen rooney vs rebekah vardy case.'

Dave and Coleen to the rescue! 'If we're sending Coleen to fix Brexit, Dave is her Dominic Cummings,' read another inspired tweet

Speaking to Daily Star Online, Dave remained bashful about his involvement, simply saying: 'Firstly I hope Coleen is okay. To have a friend betray her like that is something you don't expect.'

In her original post, Coleen wrote: 'For a few years now someone who I trusted to follow me on my personal Instagram account has been consistently informing The Sun newspaper of my private posts and stories.

'There has been so much information given to them about me, my friends and my family - all without my permission or knowledge. After a long time of trying to figure out who it could be, for various reasons, I had a suspicion.

Super sleuth: On Wednesday morning the mother of four posted on Twitter and Instagram, admitting she has been planting false Instagram stories on her private page

'To try and prove this, I came up with an idea, I blocked everyone from viewing Instagram except ONE account. '

She continued: '(Those on my private account must have been wondering why I haven't had stories on there for a while). Over the past five months I have posted a series of false stories to see if they made their way into the Sun newspaper.

'And you know what, they did! The story about gender selection in Mexico, the story about returning to TV and then the latest story about the basement flood in my new house.

'It's been tough keeping it to myself and not making any comment at all, especially when the stories have been leaked, however I had to. Now I know for certain which account/individual it's come from.

War of words: After Coleen shared her allegations against Rebekah on Wednesday, her fellow WAG, who is currently on holiday with Jamie in Dubai, hit back minutes later

'I have saved and screenshotted all the original stories which clearly show just one person has viewed them. It's......... Rebekah Vardy's account.'

She also wrote: 'This has been a burden in my life for a few years now and finally I have got to the bottom of it......'

After Coleen shared her allegations against Rebekah on Wednesday, her fellow WAG, who is currently on holiday with Jamie in Dubai, hit back minutes later on social media and denied the accusations.

She wrote: 'Can’t believe I’m even having to write this. I’m pregnant & on holiday & am at a loss to why she would do this.

'I’m now having to take legal advice as I can’t deal with this stress myself when I’m this pregnant.

Disgusted: Rebekah (left) has denied Coleen's accusations that she has been selling stories on her (the pair pictured at the England vs Wales match in France in 2016)

She also shared: 'As I have just said to you on the phone, I wish you had called me if you thought this.

'I never speak to anyone about you as various journalists who have asked me to over the years can vouch for.

'If you thought this was happening you can could have told me & I could have changed my passwords to see if it stopped.'

She continued: 'Over the years various people have had access to my insta & just this week I found I was following people I didn't know and have never followed myself.

'I'm not being funny but I don't need the money, what would I gain from selling stories on you?

'I liked you a lot Coleen & I'm so upset that you have chosen to do this especially when I'm heavily pregnant.

'I'm disgusted that I'm even having to deny this. You should have called me the first time this happened [broken heart emoji].'
description: Coleen Rooney may have a Manchester based poker player to thank after she turned super sleuth to investigate who has been leaking private stories about her family to the press.
